text: Ariocarpus kotschoubeyanus is a species of plant in the family Cactaceae. It is endemic to Coahuila and Nuevo León states, and southwards into Querétaro state, in northeastern Mexico. Its natural habitat is hot deserts. It was named after the noble Kochubey family. It is threatened by habitat loss. Close up on flower ==Sources== * Sotomayor, M.M. & Arredondo, A.G. 2002. Ariocarpus kotschoubeyanus. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007. title: Ariocarpus kotschoubeyanus
